013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArrayUtils.*;
017
018import java.util.*;
019import java.util.function.*;
020
021import org.apache.http.*;
022import org.apache.http.message.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026
027/**
028 * A parsed <c>Accept-Encoding</c> or similar header value.
029 *
030 * <p>
031 * The returned ranges are sorted such that the most acceptable value is available at ordinal position
032 * <js>'0'</js>, and the least acceptable at position n-1.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='topic'>RFC2616 Specification</h5>
035 *
036 * The Accept-Encoding request-header field is similar to Accept, but restricts the content-codings (section 3.5) that
037 * are acceptable in the response.
038 *
039 * <p class='bcode'>
040 *    Accept-Encoding  = "Accept-Encoding" ":"
041 *                       1#( codings [ ";" "q" "=" qvalue ] )
042 *    codings          = ( content-coding | "*" )
043 * </p>
044 *
045 * <p>
046 * Examples of its use are:
047 * <p class='bcode'>
048 *    Accept-Encoding: compress, gzip
049 *    Accept-Encoding:
050 *    Accept-Encoding: *
051 *    Accept-Encoding: compress;q=0.5, gzip;q=1.0
052 *    Accept-Encoding: gzip;q=1.0, identity; q=0.5, *;q=0
053 * </p>
054 *
055 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
056 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestCommonBasics">juneau-rest-common Basics</a>
057 *    <li class='extlink'><a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html">Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1</a>
058 * </ul>
059 */
060@BeanIgnore
061public class StringRanges {
062
063   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
064   // Static
065   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
066
067   /** Represents an empty string ranges object. */
068   public static final StringRanges EMPTY = new StringRanges("");
069
070   private static final Cache<String,StringRanges> CACHE = Cache.of(String.class, StringRanges.class).build();
071
072   /**
073    * Returns a parsed string range header value.
074    *
075    * @param value The raw header value.
076    * @return A parsed header value.
077    */
078   public static StringRanges of(String value) {
079      return isEmpty(value) ? EMPTY : CACHE.get(value, ()->new StringRanges(value));
080   }
081
082   /**
083    * Returns a parsed string range header value.
084    *
085    * @param value The raw header value.
086    * @return A parsed header value.
087    */
088   public static StringRanges of(StringRange...value) {
089      return value == null ? null : new StringRanges(value);
090   }
091
092   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
093   // Instance
094   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
095
096   private final StringRange[] value;
097   private final String string;
098
099   /**
100    * Constructor.
101    *
102    * @param value The string range header value.
103    */
104   public StringRanges(String value) {
105      this(parse(value));
106   }
107
108   /**
109    * Constructor.
110    *
111    * @param value The string range header value.
112    */
113   public StringRanges(StringRange...value) {
114      this.string = Utils.join(value, ", ");
115      this.value = copyOf(value);
116   }
117
118   /**
119    * Constructor.
120    *
121    * @param e The parsed string range header value.
122    */
123   public StringRanges(HeaderElement...e) {
124
125      value = new StringRange[e.length];
126      for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++)
127         value[i] = new StringRange(e[i]);
128      Arrays.sort(value, RANGE_COMPARATOR);
129
130      this.string = value.length == 1 ? value[0].toString() : Utils.join(value, ", ");
131   }
132
133   /**
134    * Compares two StringRanges for equality.
135    *
136    * <p>
137    * The values are first compared according to <c>qValue</c> values.
138    * Should those values be equal, the <c>type</c> is then lexicographically compared (case-insensitive) in
139    * ascending order, with the <js>"*"</js> type demoted last in that order.
140    */
141   private static final Comparator<StringRange> RANGE_COMPARATOR = (o1, o2) -> {
142      // Compare q-values.
143      int qCompare = Float.compare(o2.getQValue(), o1.getQValue());
144      if (qCompare != 0)
145         return qCompare;
146
147      // Compare media-types.
148      // Note that '*' comes alphabetically before letters, so just do a reverse-alphabetical comparison.
149      return o2.toString().compareTo(o1.toString());
150    };
151
152   /**
153    * Given a list of media types, returns the best match for this string range header.
154    *
155    * <p>
156    * Note that fuzzy matching is allowed on the media types where the string range header may
157    * contain additional subtype parts.
158    * <br>For example, given identical q-values and an string range value of <js>"text/json+activity"</js>,
159    * the media type <js>"text/json"</js> will match if <js>"text/json+activity"</js> or <js>"text/activity+json"</js>
160    * isn't found.
161    * <br>The purpose for this is to allow serializers to match when artifacts such as <c>id</c> properties are
162    * present in the header.
163    *
164    * <p>
165    * See <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/activitypub/#retrieving-objects">ActivityPub / Retrieving Objects</a>
166    *
167    * @param names The names to match against.
168    * @return The index into the array of the best match, or <c>-1</c> if no suitable matches could be found.
169    */
170   public int match(List<String> names) {
171      if (string.isEmpty())
172         return -1;
173
174      int matchQuant = 0, matchIndex = -1;
175      float q = 0f;
176
177      // Media ranges are ordered by 'q'.
178      // So we only need to search until we've found a match.
179      for (StringRange mr : value) {
180         float q2 = mr.getQValue();
181
182         if (q2 < q || q2 == 0)
183            break;
184
185         for (int i = 0; i < names.size(); i++) {
186            String mt = names.get(i);
187            int matchQuant2 = mr.match(mt);
188
189            if (matchQuant2 > matchQuant) {
190               matchIndex = i;
191               matchQuant = matchQuant2;
192               q = q2;
193            }
194         }
195      }
196
197      return matchIndex;
198   }
199
200   /**
201    * Returns the {@link MediaRange} at the specified index.
202    *
203    * @param index The index position of the media range.
204    * @return The {@link MediaRange} at the specified index or <jk>null</jk> if the index is out of range.
205    */
206   public StringRange getRange(int index) {
207      if (index < 0 || index >= value.length)
208         return null;
209      return value[index];
210   }
211
212   /**
213    * Returns the string ranges that make up this object.
214    *
215    * @return The string ranges that make up this object.
216    */
217   public List<StringRange> toList() {
218      return alist(value);
219   }
220
221   /**
222    * Performs an action on the string ranges that make up this object.
223    *
224    * @param action The action to perform.
225    * @return This object.
226    */
227   public StringRanges forEachRange(Consumer<StringRange> action) {
228      for (StringRange r : value)
229         action.accept(r);
230      return this;
231   }
232
233   private static HeaderElement[] parse(String value) {
234      return value == null ? null : BasicHeaderValueParser.parseElements(emptyIfNull(StringUtils.trim(value)), null);
235   }
236
237   @Override /* Object */
238   public String toString() {
239      return string;
240   }
241}
